required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assess Aesthetic Improvement With QM1114-DP in Subjects With Moderate to Severe Lateral Canthal Lines and Glabellar Lines
clinical_study.official_title: Open-label Study to Assess Aesthetic Improvement Following Treatment With QM1114-DP in Subjects With Moderate to Severe Lateral Canthal Lines and Glabellar Lines

brief_summary.textblock: This study to assess aesthetic improvement following treatment with QM1114-DP.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an open-label, single-center multi-center study to assess aesthetic improvement in the Glabellar and Lateral Canthal regions following treatment with QM1114-DP.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Open Label single site study for treatment of GL and LCL with single treatment of QM1114-DP

primary_outcome.measure: Responders in QM1114-DP versus Placebo using the Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS) at maximum frown at Month 1
primary_outcome.description: Responder Rate is based on the 7-point GAIS and is defined as a subject who responds at least Improved on the GAIS at maximum frown

primary_outcome.measure: Responders in QM1114-DP versus Placebo using the Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS) at maximum smile at Month 1
primary_outcome.description: Responder Rate is based on the 7-point GAIS and is defined as a subject who responds at least Improved on the GAIS at maximum smile

arm_group.arm_group_label: QM1114-DP, a Botulinum Toxin Type A (BoNT-A)
arm_group.description: QM1114-DP, a Botulinum Toxin Type A (BoNT-A); Intramuscular injection single dose

intervention.arm_group_label: QM1114-DP, a Botulinum Toxin Type A (BoNT-A)
intervention.other_name: QM1114-DP, a Botulinum Toxin Type A (BoNT-A)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or Female 18 years or older
- Moderate to severe bilaterally symmetrical LCL as assessed by the investigator
- Moderate to severe GL at maximum frown as assessed by the Investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous use of any botulinum toxin in facial areas within 9 months prior to study treatment
- Female who is pregnant, breast feeding or intends to conceive a child during the study.
- Known allergy to hypersensitivity or any component of the Investigational product
